title: Library of Christian Classics - 26 Volumes - modern translations
description:
There are several series called "Library of Christian Classics" out there.  This one consists of 26 volumes first published in book form in the 1950s and still in print today (Westminster/John Knox Press, very expensive), and widely used in seminaries and other academic settings.

The series includes volumes by Augustine, Thomas Aquinas, Martin Luther and John Calvin, as well as many lesser authors from the early Church through the medieval and reformation periods.  

These files are high quality .pdfs taken from the 2006 CD-ROM edition of the series.  As far as I know they are not available anywhere else on the web.

(Please note that the .pdf bookmarks contain links to places on the CD-ROM that are not included in these files, so just ignore them.)

The publisher says this about the series:

Long recognized for the quality of its translations, introductions, explanatory notes, and indexes, the Library of Christian Classics provides scholars and students with modern English translations of some of the most significant Christian theological texts in history.
